name: Planets Under Attack
description: Play as humans or robots in a brand new sci-fi strategy adventure! Travel into the far reaches of space, through cleverly designed star constellations and variable game modes, conquering enemy planets using 15 combinable technologies.

reviews.review_text: 7.5/10 - Exciting, Planet based strategy game!  I usually don't like games under TopWare; but this game is a gem! For a highly discounted price I would highly recommend this game. For $10... Maybe not.   I really love the campaign. I've completed 12 of the 36 levels in about 45 minutes. The degree of difficulty is increasing at a rapid rate. With 3 levels of difficulty I see some good replay value ahead. There are some easy to impossible achievements, card drops and more.   I didn't find a multiplayer game yet, but I have a feeling during popular hours it will happen. This consists of 4 players building defenses and conquering the solar system. It's a calculated numbers game which I am really enjoying!  Worth $6-7     Accidently Reviewed

'Planets Under Attack' is a strategy gem: very simple concept, yet has just enough depth to the gameplay to make it not just addicting but weirdly satisfying, especially after playing tug of war with the AI over a planet for what seems like forever and finally ripping it from their hands at the same time you attack their last planet.   A quick summary of the gameplay: you start with usually one planet in one of multiple gametypes, including a deathmatch type, king of the hill type, and a gametype where you vie for control of specific planets ( the first to control all the marked planets wins, regardless of how many planets the other players have). You click on another planet and hold the mouse button to determine how many ships you want to send; neutral planets/your own planets dont cost any money to invade, but enemy planets do--at least for the human race, the only race i've played as so far, but i've read that the robots play differently--and you go from there, upgrading your planets to increase taxes and building up your defenses by transferring ships to increase the population. Again, on the surface, simple, but a game can quickly dissolve into chaos requiring quick thinking and quicker clicking to turn the tide.  Definitely recommended if you get a coupon, but for $10, its a great strategy time killer that also has a fun multiplayer. Check it out.

The game concept is good enough, especially for the price point of $0.99 USD (Steam sale).  However, for those looking for cooperative mode vs. AI, in an online capacity, know that the game does not currently support it. Despite advertising it as such and asserting that it offers this capability, the game does not at this provide it. A lengthy thread on the forums has also gone unanswered by the developers so no clarity has been shed on the subject. As such, no online coop campaign OR skirmish options exist for players vs. AI.

I just got the game and am unable to figure it out completely. The 'Controls' secition only lists using the mouse wheel to mark a planet of yours as 'Battle Mode' which means ships can be launched from it I found out and 'Defend Mode' which means when you send ships that planet will not send them and they will come from other planets. There was mention in the tutorial about clearing a marker, but I can't find any way to change what I assume is the marker around the enemy planet (by just clicking fast?) or to recall ships once I send them. The control scheme is far from 'intuitive' and if that is all there is to the game I can't see it being very fun.

A good Hybrid 3x type of game (Astralux, Eufloria, Little Stars for Little Wars, Abstractanks, etc) pretty much ruined by TERRIBLE controls and cheating AI.  Bottom line, this game could have easily been contender for the best Indie game of 2012 except for the mind numbingly bad control mechanisms. There are controls 3x type of games adhere to, and this one broke all of that adhereance, and in the process ruined what could have been an amazing game.  Sad to say, while being a HUGE fan of 3x games like this, I couldn't tolerate this one for more than an hour.
